TextView.android:text: Call for help for possible surgical intervention
Does the patient have a low SBP
Treat tension pneumothorax with emergency needle decompression
Give oxygen 5 litres if SpO2 less than 90 or respiratory distress
Urgently send blood for type and cross match
Apply pressure immediately to stop bleeding
If possible pelvic fracture – apply pelvic binder
Call for help and plan emergency surgical intervention
If patient remains in shock after 2 litres of IV fluids – transfuse
Call for help from district clinician/surgeon
Expose and Evaluate for Life Threats
Consider possible spleen or liver injury
Are there penetrating injuries to abdomen or distended or painful abdomen?
Consider diagnostic peritoneal lavage or ultrasound to check for internal bleeding
Trauma with neck pain or possible cervical spine injury?
If severe headache, manage as possible head injury
Palpate chest for rib fractures and if present, consider pneumothorax
